subject: Re: [junit] Re: Runner for non static inner class in JUnit 4.x
msgSnippet: All, It would seem that the perfect solution would be: 1) The ability to add to the default Runner builder 2) A command-line flag to configure #1 3) An Eclipse
messageBody:
All,

It would seem that the perfect solution would be:

1) The ability to add to the default Runner builder
2) A command-line flag to configure #1
3) An Eclipse setting to set #2

It sounds like everyone who is requesting this feature is a user of JDave,
and a quick Eclipse setting would give them everything they want. It would
also allow users of other JUnit-based frameworks to do similar things.
Thoughts?

David Saff

On Wed, Jan 14, 2009 at 3:42 AM, Lasse Koskela <lasse.koskela@...>wrote:

> Hi David, Tuomas,
>
> I'm not exactly unbiased either, having submitted a couple of patches
> for JDave back in the day and just having joined a project that has
> 5000+ JDave tests.
>
> With that said, I don't think the increase in complexity that we're
> talking about here is all that big. If you don't specify a runner
> (non-static inner class), one is inherited from one level up
> (declaring class).
>
> Again, I might be biased but I sure would like to be able to run just
> one of the tests.
>
>
> Lasse
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <david@...> wrote:
> > Do you think the overall ease of use to people who need this feature
> will be

> > David Saff

> >
> > > hey David,
> > >
> > > i uploaded the patch as a file,
> > >
> > >
> > >
>
> http://f1.grp.yahoofs.com/v1/cBhbSQYycXqWtmfu6mA5iis6I67Qo0Itb3lfEH-tMTD2PqfQBWFNQwiqbje7jxu7yGSHFHijEoZPnMvQpZtq0gohmbE9pzSYXRseJ5ewyt0/nonstaticinnerclasses.patch
> > >
> > > or if that link is relative to my session it's
> > > nonstaticinnerclasses.patch under files here in Yahoo Groups.
> > >
> > > in JUnit4 speak:
> > >
> > > public class RegularJunit4 {
> > > public class NonStaticInnerClass {
> > > @Test
> > > public void testMethod() {
> > > }
> > > }
> > > }
> > >
> > > running testMethod() is not possible since NonStaticInnerClass cannot
> > > be instantiated from the outside.
> > >
> > > in JDave:
> > >
> > > @RunWith(JDaveRunner.class)
> > > public static class ASpec extends Specification<Void> {
> > > public class AContext {
> > > public void aBehavior() {}
> > > }
> > > }
> > >
> > > AContext is instantiated by SpecRunner which JDaveRunner delegates to.
> > >
> > > When I run this with current JUnit,
> > > AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder#runnerForClass(final Class<?>
> > > testClass) picks out the @RunWith annotation and uses that to run my
> > > spec(test class).
> > >
> > > However if I want to run just a single behavior (test method) from
> > > this spec for example from Eclipse. Eclipse tells JUnit to run class
> > > ASpec.AContext and method aBehavior JUnit then sees what builder it
> > > should use for AContext, and doesn't find the annotation there and
> > > tries to use the regular JUnit4 builder and since it's a JDave spec it
> > > fails to run.
> > >
> > > What I want to do is: in case AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder notices
> > > that the TestClass is a non-static member class, which it has no
> > > chance of being able run anyway, it checks whether the declaring class
> > > of the testclass would be able to run it instead.
> > >
> > > In the case of JDave, the declaring class would have the @RunWith
> > > annotation, and with the Filter created by FilterRequest, JDave can
> > > then choose which Context and Spec it should actually allow to run.
> > >
> > > br,
> > > Tuomas
> > >
> > > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <david@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > JDave is cool. I'm not 100% clear what you want to do, and I don't
> > > see the
> > > > patch. Could you perhaps include a small test case as inline text?
> > > >
> > > > David Saff
> > > >
> > > > On Tue, Dec 30, 2008 at 10:27 AM, tuomaskarkkainenri <
> > > > tuomaskarkkainenri@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > > I participate in JDave (http://jdave.org). A BDD framework
> for Java
> > > > > that takes advantage of JUnit for example for Eclipse integration.
> > > > >
> > > > > We have tests in non-static inner classes of our test classes.
> These
> > > > > run wonderfully using the @RunWith annotation and our own runner.
> > > > >
> > > > > however, for individual tests, this doesn't work. What I would
> like
> > > > > to do is that AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder would check
> whether or
> > > > > not the test class is a non static member class. if it is, then I
> > > > > would grab the runner of the declaring class instead.
> > > > >
> > > > > I made a patch implementing this. I will try to attach it.
